1.text: The man that with a stiff neck despiseth him that reproveth him, shall suddenly be destroyed: and health shall not follow him.

2.text: When just men increase, the people shall rejoice: when the wicked shall bear rule, the people shall mourn.

3.text: A man that loveth wisdom, rejoiceth his father: but he that maintaineth bar lots, shall squander away his substance.

4.text: A just king setteth up the land: a covetous man shall destroy it.

5.text: A man that speaketh to his friend with flattering and dissembling words, spreadeth a net for his feet.

6.text: A snare shall entangle the wicked man when he sinneth: and the just shall praise and rejoice.

7.text: The just taketh notice of the cause of the poor: the wicked is void of knowledge.

8.text: Corrupt men bring a city to ruin: but wise men turn away wrath.

9.text: If a wise man contend with a fool, whether he be angry or laugh, he shall find no rest.

10.text: Bloodthirsty men hate the upright: but just men seek his soul.

11.text: A fool uttereth all his mind: a wise man deferreth, and keepeth it till afterwards.

12.text: A prince that gladly heareth lying words, hath all his servants wicked.

13.text: The poor man and the creditor have met one another: the Lord is the enlightener of them both.

14.text: The king that judgeth the poor in truth, his throne shall be established for ever.

15.text: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but the child that is left to his own will bringeth his mother to shame.

16.text: When the wicked are multiplied, crimes shall be multiplied: but the just shall see their downfall.

17.text: Instruct thy son, and he shall refresh thee, and shall give delight to thy soul.

18.text: When prophecy shall fail, the people shall be scattered abroad: but he that keepeth the law is blessed.

19.text: A slave will not be corrected by words: because he understandeth what thou sayest, and will not answer.

20.text: Hast thou seen a man hasty to speak? folly is rather to be looked for, than his amendment.

21.text: He that nourisheth his servant delicately from his childhood, afterwards shall find him stubborn.

22.text: A passionate man provoketh quarrels: and he that is easily stirred up to wrath, shall be more prone to sin.

23.text: Humiliation followeth the proud: and glory shall uphold the humble of spirit.

24.text: He that is partaker with a thief, hateth his own soul: he heareth one putting him to his oath, and discovereth not.

25.text: He that feareth man, shall quickly fall: he that trusteth in the Lord, shall be set on high.

26.text: Many seek the face of the prince: but the judgment of every one cometh forth from the Lord.

27.text: The just abhor the wicked man: and the wicked loathe them that are in the right way. The son that keepeth the word, shall be free from destruction.
